verses.roman:
śata-varṣā hy anāvṛṣṭir
bhaviṣyaty ulbaṇā bhuvi
tat-kālopacitoṣṇārko
lokāṁs trīn pratapiṣyati

synonyms: śata-varṣā—lasting one hundred years; hi—indeed; anāvṛṣṭiḥ—drought; bhaviṣyati—there will be; ulbaṇā—terrible; bhuvi—on the earth; tat-kāla—in that duration of time; upacita—accumulated; uṣṇa—whose heat; arkaḥ—the sun; lokān—the worlds; trīn—three; pratapiṣyati—will greatly burn.
translation: As cosmic annihilation approaches, a terrible drought takes place on earth for one hundred years. For one hundred years the heat of the sun gradually increases, and its blazing heat begins to torment the three worlds.
